segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle at her feet is growing, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the water, yet she keeps polishing that plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to no good, but she’s too focused to turn around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll slip before she even realizes what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is just pouring water everywhere, and she’s standing right in the middle of it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while everything around her is going wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The dish towel is bunched up in her hands, like she’s in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s going to regret ignoring all this when she finally looks down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is already streaming down the cabinets, and she’s just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone warns her before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
